page.title: 11Farming Around Holmfirth
page.content: On the farm, near where I live, work starts at 6.30a.m. each morning. The farm covers 60 acres of land and supports 55{milk cows.}It takes two men to look after the farm though sometimes a few more are brought in at week-ends.Milking starts at 7.00a.m. and finishes about 8.30a.m.During the summer months the cows are taken back into the fields after milking but in the winter they are kept inside.The cows are milked again at 4.00p.m. Machines are used to milk the cows. Each cow can yield up to 6 gallons of milk a day.The farmer bottles the milk and takes it around in his Landrover. Each year a number of calves are reared and these are taken to the {market}in Holmfirth to be sold. Replacement cattle are bought for the dairy herd whilst the{beef stock}is bred from a Charolais bull.
